column4: hi all. does anyone knows what this is....  E: /var/cache/apt/archives/pidgin-data_1%3a2.7.9-1ubuntu0+pidgin1.10.04_all.deb: trying to overwrite '/usr/share/pixmaps/pidgin/protocols/48/facebook.png', which is also in package pidgin-facebookchat 0
i cant upgrade this package
its a packaging bug
what version of ubuntu are you on?
oh 10.04 i guess from the package name
let me see if that bug's been reported
where did you get version 2.7.9?
: i just did un apt-get update and than upgrade
: my pidgin is 2.7.9
2.6.6 is the version in 10.04.... do you have a PPA or some other repo added for it?
2.7.9 is apparently uploaded but not yet on the servers for 11.04, but thats it...
probably its a pidgin dependecy problem
its not  dependency thing. it's someone packaged it wrong so the same file is in two packages. but i cant figure out who packaged it since that package doesnt look like it actually came from ubuntu
it probably didn't
then you need to talk to whomever packaged it. it's not an ubuntu bug.
so hot fix now the var/lock
i have this update manager attention icon i have on the sys try
for now, i'd say lock the version on those packages in synaptic or remove pidgin-facebookchat until its fixed
: ok thanks :)
look in /etc/apt/sources.list and /etc/apt/sources.list.d/* to try to figure out where the package is coming from and notify them of teh bug
ok i will.
